column4: anybody can help me here on how can i make my ubuntu install even faster?  :(
thru the Alternate CD instead of Desktop CD
you mean, install?  yes, i did it already
you said 'ubuntu install' ... so say 'an ubuntu installed'
i'm wondering why ubuntu amd64 on my amd turion64 laptop is very, very slow..
it's my 4th time to install ubuntu on different ways
it still ambiguous what you want. You just want to make ubuntu faster after you installed it or you want to make the installation process faster ?
even in console, before the characters that i encode, it takes seconds before the characters will appear
i already installed ubuntu.. and i'm wondering why this is very, very slow
how fast is your processor and how much RAM do you have ?
1.8ghz amd turion64 @ 512ram. my laptop is fast with other distros
it should'nt be slow but you have to consider that Ubuntu loads a lot of stuff in order to offer some services, like bluetooth
are you feeling the system slow as a whole or only during specific tasks ?
i know. but it's not the reason. it's really something with xorg or what that eats a lot of cpu..
slow as a whole
what Ubuntu version are you using ?
try to install the video driver.
binarydigit, it should give you a better performance
it should give you a better performance
what video driver? i'm already using fglrx here
hmmm
can you do a bechmark ? Measure precisely how long tasks takes ? I think you may be suffering from a placebo efftct. It should'nt be slow with your config
